title: Abreu, Rizzo named as Hank Aaron Award finalists
text:
View image | gettyimages.com
Two of Chicago’s finest hitters are finalist for the Hank Aaron Award, the MLB announced Monday.
The award is given annually to a player recognized as the most outstanding offensive performer in his league. This season, both sides of Chicago had dominant offensive players.
White Sox first baseman Jose Abreu has been perhaps the one offensive player who didn’t disappoint — though his numbers dipped from his rookie season. In 2015, Abreu hit 30 homers (36 in 2014), produced 100 RBIs (106, 2014) and maintained a .290 batting average (.317, 2014).
Abreu’s counterpart on the North Side, Cubs first baseman Anthony Rizzo, is also a finalist for the offensive award. Rizzo has been a huge stabilizing force for a young, but talented Cubs squad. He finished the season with 31 home runs, 101 RBIs and a .278 BA.
These two hitters appear to be viable candidates for many Hank Aaron Awards during the course of their careers.
